definitions.definition: a large area of land that is thickly covered with trees

examples.text: One careless match can start a **forest fire**.
Thousands of hectares of forest are destroyed each year.
Forest is being cleared to make way for new farming land.
He warned her never to enter the forest at night.
Much of Europe was once covered in forest.
They got lost in the forest.
Thick forest stretched as far as the eye could see.
We slashed our way through the dense forest.
a large stretch of virgin forest
The species is found in both coniferous and deciduous forests.

definitions.definition: a mass of tall narrow objects that are close together

examples.text: a forest of cranes on the skyline

definitions.definition: to not see or understand the main point about something, because you are paying too much attention to small details

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘wooded area kept for hunting’, also denoting any uncultivated land): via Old French from late Latin forestis (silva) , literally ‘(wood) outside’, from Latin foris ‘outside’, from fores ‘door’.
